= Components =

*Component items*:
  * *Lung sensory data* (*lung-sensory-data*)
   * Lung - pulmonary neuroepithelial bodies (pulmonary-neuroepithelial-bodies -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_NOD LPC.PN.SG.NOD]): trachea, bronchial tree and lungs - intraepithelial receptors
   * Lung - pericardium and pleura receptors (pericardium-pleura-receptors -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_UDRG LPC.PN.SG.UDRG]): somatic sensations
   * Lung - pulmonary stretch receptors (pulmonary-stretch-receptors -> [BrainRegionLPC_PN_SG_JUG LPC.PN.SG.JUG]): imitate the Hering-Breuer reflex, which reduces the respiratory rate; increased firing from the stretch receptors also increases production of pulmonary surfactant
  * *Lung visceral activity* (*lung-visceral-activity*)
   * [http://education.yahoo.com/reference/gray/subjects/subject/237 Lung - glands of trachea, lungs, and bronchi] ([BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_PUG AVA.PN.PSYM.PUG] -> [HumanMusclesTorso visceral-glands]): increase in airway secretions
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bronchus Lung - smooth muscles of trachea and bronchial tree] ([BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_PUG AVA.PN.PSYM.PUG] -> [HumanMusclesTorso smooth-muscles]): constriction of trachea and bronchioles
  * *Lung breath muscles* (*lung-breath-muscles*)
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semispinalis_dorsi Lung - thoracic diaphragm] ([BrainRegionLPC_SC_VH_PHR LPC.SC.VH.PHR] -> [HumanMusclesTorso thoracic-diaphragm]): increases thoracic cavity volume; inhalation
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stylopharyngeus_muscle Lung - stylopharyngeus muscle] ([BrainRegionHMA_HM_AMB HMA.HM.AMB] -> [HumanMusclesNeck stylopharyngeus-muscle]): elevate the larynx, elevate the pharynx, swallowing
